channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 街谈巷议：一元店的核心客户感到了压力。这使得这些公司在证明其扭亏为盈的努力正在取得成效时变得十分棘手。
item.description:
Heard on the Street: Dollar stores’ core customers are feeling squeezed. That makes it a tricky time for these companies to prove that their turnaround efforts are bearing fruit. https://t.co/QXccHKGR8Q https://t.co/QXccHKGR8Q

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 日本股市创下历史新高，经济复苏的最后一环正在逐步到位。公众想知道为什么要花这么长时间。
item.description:
Japan’s stock market has hit a record and the final piece of its economic recovery is falling into place. The public wants to know why it has taken so long. https://t.co/EtsADykWhG https://t.co/EtsADykWhG

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: Airbnb 新任财务总监的上任正值旅游行业的拐点，也是这家短租公司寻求地域扩张和新产品的时候
item.description:
Airbnb’s new finance chief takes charge at an inflection point for the travel industry, and as the short-term rental company looks toward geographic expansion and new products https://t.co/n5zixE9dRf https://t.co/n5zixE9dRf

item.title: 去年，自动驾驶机器人出租车在城市道路上行驶。现在，它们又在高速公路上大显身手。
item.description:
Last year, self-driving robotaxis took on city streets. Now, they’re taking on freeways. https://t.co/0pLp4NonaV https://t.co/0pLp4NonaV

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 日产和本田将考虑建立电动汽车合作关系，作为减少碳排放和致命事故努力的一部分
item.description:

item.title: 街谈巷议股市多头寄希望于数万亿美元从货币市场基金中流出并推动股市上涨的想法是错误的

item.title: 在最发达城市的二手房价格创下 2011 年以来最严重的月度跌幅之后，中国房地产市场的低迷势头仍未减弱。
item.description:
China’s real-estate slump shows no signs of losing steam after secondhand home prices in the most developed cities saw their worst monthly decline since 2011 https://t.co/Js2AclmxKx https://t.co/Js2AclmxKx

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 美国橄榄球联盟（NFL）自由球员签约仪式开始后的几天里，整个联盟都在疯狂地争夺一个已经贬值的位置，但这个位置仍然拥有一些橄榄球界的大牌球星。
item.description:
The opening days of NFL free agency were marked by a frenzy of activity at a position that has become devalued across the league—but still boasts some of the game’s biggest names. https://t.co/E4BTNRhV7m https://t.co/E4BTNRhV7m

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 在接受 @JoannaStern 的独家专访时，OpenAI 首席技术官米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）解释了公司新推出的 Sora 人工智能视频工具及其推广计划。

item.title: 要想获得丝般顺滑的烈酒，不妨试试用橄榄油摇晃烈酒。它能让这款橄榄马提尼酒变得危险易饮。

item.title: 奥克兰运动家队（Oakland A's）发布了拟在拉斯维加斯建造的新主场的效果图，但关于在此期间的活动和比赛地点的计划细节却少得令人吃惊。
item.description:
The Oakland A’s released renderings for its proposed new home in Las Vegas, but plans for what to do and where to play in the interim are surprisingly light on details https://t.co/kTiV1aa3bf https://t.co/kTiV1aa3bf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 百元大钞是美国最常见的纸币，但它的储钱功能远大于花钱功能
item.description:
The $100 bill is far and away the most common U.S. paper currency, but the bill is more effective for storing money than spending it https://t.co/GNiPiY4zzA https://t.co/GNiPiY4zzA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 中国政府表示不允许强制出售 TikTok，这限制了该应用程序所有者的选择，因为买家已开始排队竞购 TikTok 在美国的业务。
item.description:
The Chinese government is signaling that it won’t allow a forced sale of TikTok, limiting options for the app’s owners as buyers begin lining up to bid for its U.S. operations https://t.co/Xwyhvp3I2V https://t.co/Xwyhvp3I2V

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 哈马斯呼吁巴勒斯坦人周五在耶路撒冷的阿克萨清真寺与以色列对抗，届时大批朝拜者将考验旨在斋月期间维持和平的以色列当局。
item.description:
Hamas has called for Palestinians to confront Israel at the Al Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem Friday, when large numbers of worshipers will test Israeli authorities who aim to keep peace during Ramadan https://t.co/vCQg7GLOQk https://t.co/vCQg7GLOQk

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京已基本确定将赢得俄罗斯总统大选，但他仍在努力争取更高的投票率，以巩固其未来六年的执政地位。
item.description:
Vladimir Putin is all but guaranteed to win Russia’s presidential vote, but he is seeking a large turnout to anchor his next six years in power https://t.co/LJ6XhIGrhw https://t.co/LJ6XhIGrhw

item.title: Z世代的普遍悲观情绪表现为对华盛顿的空前怀疑。"我们已经受够了"
item.description:
Gen Z’s widespread gloominess is manifesting in an unparalleled skepticism of Washington. “We’re just kind of over it.” https://t.co/ehKkfRE4MH https://t.co/ehKkfRE4MH https://t.co/ehKkfRE4MH https://t.co/ehKkfRE4MH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 乘坐火车可以游览美国的大片土地，但这是否意味着这是一个好主意呢？一些旅行者说，即使经常出现延误和车速缓慢的情况，也没有什么比坐火车更好了。
item.description:
It’s possible to see large swathes of the U.S. by train, but does that mean it’s a good idea? Some travelers say that even with the frequent delays and slow speeds, nothing beats it. https://t.co/H3C5BXfvww https://t.co/H3C5BXfvww

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 理查德-哈斯（Richard Haass）写道，以色列完全有权对哈马斯的袭击做出军事回应，但自 10 月 7 日以来，以色列在战术和战略上的选择却使其雪上加霜。
item.description:
Israel had every right to respond militarily to Hamas’s attack, but its tactical and strategic choices since Oct. 7 have left it worse off, writes Richard Haass https://t.co/jNMKzo4V3H https://t.co/jNMKzo4V3H

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 15, 2024

item.title: 勒布朗-詹姆斯的场均得分、篮板和助攻都非常出色。但这些数据也掩盖了他职业生涯中一个非凡的怪现象。
